item.title: The non cleaning of rubbish, tree leaves, dog and fox excrement. Has resulted in a very un pleasant place to park resident vehicles in. Including now two blocked gully type drains. Flooding the complete carark., 22nd February
item.description:
This carpark is always been missed by your street cleaning team, despite many times been reported by phone calls from myself. admittedly was cleaned once last spring. This is an on going issue over many years. Now result in the two gully type drains to block up resulting in a near impossible task of getting in you vehicle without get your footware /feet wet, with the flooding. Flooding issues was reported by myself in December gully cleaning vehicle came, saw left without unblocking drains.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Red Barracks Road, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Christmas tree in Benhill road, 22nd February
item.description:
Let's try this again, since you claim you haven't been able to find the Christmas tree that has been abandoned there for two months now. As indicated previously, the tree is at the entrance of Benhill road - coming from Edmund street - on the right, near flat 23. On Google Maps, it's here: https://maps.app.goo.gl/ji5DRLz5TnMXZkfc9 On What3Words, it's ///toned.kinds.known It's literally impossible to miss it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Benhill Road, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Speed warning radar facing wrong way, 22nd February
item.description:
The speed radar that's been fitted is not in the right location. It needs to be further down bowness road and rather than measuring vehicles speed from erith road to long lane it needs to measure cars that have came off long lane heading towards erith road. The sign should be nearer to houses 18-22 as this is where cars have really picked up speed after they've came round the width restriction bend at the top of Bowness road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 46, Bowness Road, Barnehurst, Bexleyheath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Banging drain cover., 22nd February
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stoke Newington Church Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Insufficient crossing type, 22nd February
item.description:
Today my dog was killed and nearly my sons life was lost due to the crossing at north cray rd ,my son had pressed for the crossing , and as there is no sound or light signal my son waited for longer then he should and the near side car stopped but the time had elapsed when my son crossed and the far side car continued running over and killing our dog this could of been my son , I reported this crossing over a year ago .what has to happen for the crossing to be made safe ???
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): North Cray Road, North Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Repair on road cobbles poorly finished, 22nd February
item.description:
The road was repaired about a month ago (possibly Conway contractor). They have made non effort to put the cobbles back in the same way they took them up so the yellow and white road markings are all over the place. Was this work not checked? Or are they coming back to finish the job?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 78, Edmund Street, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
